text: Psalm 42
Hope in God in the Midst of Despair

For the \add music\add* director. A maskil of the sons of Korah.\f + \fr Ps 42 \ft The Hebrew Bible counts the superscription as the first verse of the psalm; the English verse number is reduced by one \f*
As a deer longs for streams of water,
so my soul longs for you, O God.
My soul thirsts for God, for \add the\add* living God.
When shall I come and appear before God?\f + \fr 42:2 \ft Some Hebrew manuscripts and versions read “and see the face of God?” \f*
My tears have been my food day and night,
while \add they\add* say to me all day \add long\add*,
“Where \add is\add* your God?”
These I remember and I pour out my soul within me:
that I would go with the multitude;
I led them \add in procession\add* to the house\f + \fr 42:4 \ft Or “temple” \f* of God,
with a voice of rejoicing and thanksgiving,
a crowd celebrating a festival.
Why are you ⸤in despair⸥,\f + \fr 42:5 \ft Literally “bowed down” \f* O my soul,
and disturbed within me?
Hope in God, because I will again praise him,
\add for\add* the salvation of his presence.
O my God, within me my soul is ⸤in despair⸥;\f + \fr 42:6 \ft Literally “bowed down” \f*
therefore I remember you from the land of Jordan
and the heights of Hermon, from the mountain of Mizar.
Deep \add is\add* calling to deep
at\f + \fr 42:7 \ft Or “to” \f* the thunder of your waterfalls.
All your breakers and your waves
have passed over me.
By day Yahweh commands his loyal love,
and in the night his song \add is\add* with me,
a prayer to the God of my life.
I say to God, my rock,
“Why have you forgotten me?
Why must I walk about mourning
because of \add the\add* oppression of \add the\add* enemy?”
\add As\add* with a shattering in my bones
my oppressors taunt me,
while they say to me ⸤all day⸥,\f + \fr 42:10 \ft Literally “all the day” \f*
“Where \add is\add* your God?”
Why are you ⸤in despair⸥,\f + \fr 42:11 \ft Literally “bowed down” \f* O my soul?
And why are you disturbed within me?
Hope in God, because I shall again praise him,
⸤my salvation⸥\f + \fr 42:11 \ft Literally “the salvation of my face” \f* and my God.
